Detailed Description

The section has a list of all the exported API which the applications need to invoke in order to use the CAN driver.

Function Documentation

int32_t CAN_configBitTime ( CAN_Handle  handle,
const CAN_DCANBitTimeParams *  bitTimeParams,
int32_t *  errCode 
)

Description
Function configures the bit time parameters for the CAN module.

Parameters
[in]handleHandle to the CAN Driver
[in]bitTimeParamsBit time configuration parameters
[out]errCodeError code populated on error
Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0
CAN_MsgObjHandle CAN_createMsgObject ( CAN_Handle  handle,
uint32_t  msgObjectNum,
const CAN_DCANMsgObjCfgParams *  msgObjectParams,
int32_t *  errCode 
)

Description
Function configures the receive or transmit message object. It also registers interrupts if enabled and registers the application provided callback function. The callback function will be invoked on data transmit complete for transmit message objects OR upon receiving data for receive message objects.

Parameters
[in]handleHandle to the CAN Driver
[in]msgObjectNumMessage Object number which has to be configured. Valid values are 1 to 64. The message object number also specifies its priority. Lower the number higher the priority.

NOTE: Since the the message object number denotes its priority, the CAN driver doesn't allocate the next available message object instead it is specified by the application.

Parameters
[in]msgObjectParamsMessage Object configuration parameters
[out]errCodeError code populated on error
Return values
Success- Handle to the message object.
Error- NULL
int32_t CAN_deinit ( CAN_Handle  handle,
int32_t *  errCode 
)

Description
Function closes the CAN driver instance and cleanups all the memory allocated by the CAN driver.

Parameters
[in]handleHandle to the CAN Driver
[out]errCodeError code populated on error
Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0

Description
Function closes the CAN driver instance and cleanups all the memory allocatedby the CAN driver.

Parameters
[in]handleHandle to the CAN Driver
[out]errCodeError code populated on error
Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0
int32_t CAN_deleteMsgObject ( CAN_MsgObjHandle  handle,
int32_t *  errCode 
)

Description
Function deletes a message object.

Parameters
[in]handleHandle to the message object
[out]errCodeError code populated on error
Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0
int32_t CAN_getData ( CAN_MsgObjHandle  handle,
CAN_DCANData *  data,
int32_t *  errCode 
)

Description
Function is used by the application to get the CAN message from message RAM using a receive message object.

Parameters
[in]handleHandle to the message object
[out]dataPointer to the data bytes received, length and message lost flag. Populated only when there is no error. If there is an error, the function returns the reason for error in errCode.
[out]errCodeError code populated on error
Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0
int32_t CAN_getOptions ( CAN_Handle  handle,
CAN_OptionTLV *  ptrOptInfo,
int32_t *  errCode 
)

Description
Function is used by the application to get the error and status information from the driver.

Parameters
[in]handleHandle to the CAN Driver
[out]ptrOptInfoOption info in TLV format which is populated with the requested information
[out]errCodeError code populated on error
Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0
CAN_Handle CAN_init ( const CAN_DCANCfgParams *  configParams,
int32_t *  errCode 
)

Description
Function initializes the CAN driver instance with the specified hardware attributes. It resets the CAN module and configures the DCAN TX/RX IO Control register. It configures the CAN driver with the control parameters.

Parameters
[in]configParamsCAN module configuration parameters
[out]errCodeError code populated on error
Return values
Success- Handle to the CAN Driver
Error- NULL
int32_t CAN_setOptions ( CAN_Handle  handle,
CAN_OptionTLV *  ptrOptInfo,
int32_t *  errCode 
)

Description
Function is used by the application to configure the driver options.

Parameters
[in]handleHandle to the CAN Driver
[in]ptrOptInfoOption info in TLV format which is used to configure the driver
[out]errCodeError code populated on error
Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0
int32_t CAN_transmitData ( CAN_MsgObjHandle  handle,
const CAN_DCANData *  data,
int32_t *  errCode 
)

Description
Function used by the application to transmit data using a transmit message object.

Parameters
[in]handleHandle to the message object
[in]dataData to be transmitted
[out]errCodeError code populated on error
Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0
